template.title: PrintToFile
template.description: Append given template to the file. The values of WHEN and TEMPLATE are the same as that of --print. FILE uses the same syntax as the output template. This option can be used multiple times

file.title: PrintToFile
file.description: Append given template to the file. The values of WHEN and TEMPLATE are the same as that of --print. FILE uses the same syntax as the output template. This option can be used multiple times

fields.title: ReplaceInMetadata
fields.description: Replace text in a metadata field using the given regex. This option can be used multiple times. Supported values of "WHEN" are the same as that of --use-postprocessor (default: pre_process)

regex.title: ReplaceInMetadata
regex.description: Replace text in a metadata field using the given regex. This option can be used multiple times. Supported values of "WHEN" are the same as that of --use-postprocessor (default: pre_process)

replace.title: ReplaceInMetadata
replace.description: Replace text in a metadata field using the given regex. This option can be used multiple times. Supported values of "WHEN" are the same as that of --use-postprocessor (default: pre_process)

password.title: Password
password.description: Account password. If this option is left out, yt-dlp will ask interactively

netrc_location.title: NetrcLocation
netrc_location.description: Location of .netrc authentication data; either the path or its containing directory. Defaults to ~/.netrc

netrc_cmd.title: NetrcCmd
netrc_cmd.description: Command to execute to get the credentials for an extractor.

ap_mso.title: ApMSO
ap_mso.description: Adobe Pass multiple-system operator (TV provider) identifier, use --ap-list-mso for a list of available MSOs

ap_password.title: ApPassword
ap_password.description: Multiple-system operator account password. If this option is left out, yt-dlp will ask interactively

client_certificate.title: ClientCertificate
client_certificate.description: Path to client certificate file in PEM format. May include the private key

client_certificate_key.title: ClientCertificateKey
client_certificate_key.description: Path to private key file for client certificate

client_certificate_password.title: ClientCertificatePassword
client_certificate_password.description: Password for client certificate private key, if encrypted. If not provided, and the key is encrypted, yt-dlp will ask interactively

concurrent_fragments.title: ConcurrentFragments
concurrent_fragments.description: Number of fragments of a dash/hlsnative video that should be downloaded concurrently (default is 1)

limit_rate.title: LimitRate
limit_rate.description: Maximum download rate in bytes per second, e.g. 50K or 4.2M

throttled_rate.title: ThrottledRate
throttled_rate.description: Minimum download rate in bytes per second below which throttling is assumed and the video data is re-extracted, e.g. 100K

file_access_retries.title: FileAccessRetries
file_access_retries.description: Number of times to retry on file access error (default is 3), or "infinite"

fragment_retries.title: FragmentRetries
fragment_retries.description: Number of retries for a fragment (default is 10), or "infinite" (DASH, hlsnative and ISM)

retry_sleep.title: RetrySleep
retry_sleep.description: Time to sleep between retries in seconds (optionally) prefixed by the type of retry (http (default), fragment, file_access, extractor) to apply the sleep to. EXPR can be a number, linear=START[:END[:STEP=1]] or exp=START[:END[:BASE=2]]. This option can be used multiple times to set the sleep for the different retry types, e.g. --retry-sleep linear=1::2 --retry-sleep fragment:exp=1:20

skip_unavailable_fragments.title: SkipUnavailableFragments
skip_unavailable_fragments.description: Skip unavailable fragments for DASH, hlsnative and ISM downloads (default)

abort_on_unavailable_fragments.title: AbortOnUnavailableFragments
abort_on_unavailable_fragments.description: Abort download if a fragment is unavailable

keep_fragments.title: KeepFragments
keep_fragments.description: Keep downloaded fragments on disk after downloading is finished

no_keep_fragments.title: NoKeepFragments
no_keep_fragments.description: Delete downloaded fragments after downloading is finished (default)

buffer_size.title: BufferSize
buffer_size.description: Size of download buffer, e.g. 1024 or 16K (default is 1024)

resize_buffer.title: ResizeBuffer
resize_buffer.description: The buffer size is automatically resized from an initial value of --buffer-size (default)

no_resize_buffer.title: NoResizeBuffer
no_resize_buffer.description: Do not automatically adjust the buffer size

http_chunk_size.title: HTTPChunkSize
http_chunk_size.description: Size of a chunk for chunk-based HTTP downloading, e.g. 10485760 or 10M (default is disabled). May be useful for bypassing bandwidth throttling imposed by a webserver (experimental)

playlist_random.title: PlaylistRandom
playlist_random.description: Download playlist videos in random order

lazy_playlist.title: LazyPlaylist
lazy_playlist.description: Process entries in the playlist as they are received. This disables n_entries, --playlist-random and --playlist-reverse

no_lazy_playlist.title: NoLazyPlaylist
no_lazy_playlist.description: Process videos in the playlist only after the entire playlist is parsed (default)

xattr_set_filesize.title: XattrSetFileSize
xattr_set_filesize.description: Set file xattribute ytdl.filesize with expected file size

hls_use_mpegts.title: HLSUseMPEGTS
hls_use_mpegts.description: Use the mpegts container for HLS videos; allowing some players to play the video while downloading, and reducing the chance of file corruption if download is interrupted. This is enabled by default for live streams

no_hls_use_mpegts.title: NoHLSUseMPEGTS
no_hls_use_mpegts.description: Do not use the mpegts container for HLS videos. This is default when not downloading live streams

download_sections.title: DownloadSections
download_sections.description: Download only chapters that match the regular expression. A "*" prefix denotes time-range instead of chapter. Negative timestamps are calculated from the end. "*from-url" can be used to download between the "start_time" and "end_time" extracted from the URL. Needs ffmpeg. This option can be used multiple times to download multiple sections, e.g. --download-sections "*10:15-inf" --download-sections "intro"

downloader.title: Downloader
downloader.description: Name or path of the external downloader to use (optionally) prefixed by the protocols (http, ftp, m3u8, dash, rstp, rtmp, mms) to use it for. Currently supports native, aria2c, avconv, axel, curl, ffmpeg, httpie, wget. You can use this option multiple times to set different downloaders for different protocols. E.g. --downloader aria2c --downloader "dash,m3u8:native" will use aria2c for http/ftp downloads, and the native downloader for dash/m3u8 downloads

downloader_args.title: DownloaderArgs
downloader_args.description: Give these arguments to the external downloader. Specify the downloader name and the arguments separated by a colon ":". For ffmpeg, arguments can be passed to different positions using the same syntax as --postprocessor-args. You can use this option multiple times to give different arguments to different downloaders

extractor_retries.title: ExtractorRetries
extractor_retries.description: Number of retries for known extractor errors (default is 3), or "infinite"

ignore_dynamic_mpd.title: IgnoreDynamicMPD
ignore_dynamic_mpd.description: Do not process dynamic DASH manifests

hls_split_discontinuity.title: HLSSplitDiscontinuity
hls_split_discontinuity.description: Split HLS playlists to different formats at discontinuities such as ad breaks

no_hls_split_discontinuity.title: NoHLSSplitDiscontinuity
no_hls_split_discontinuity.description: Do not split HLS playlists into different formats at discontinuities such as ad breaks (default)

extractor_args.title: ExtractorArgs
extractor_args.description: Pass ARGS arguments to the IE_KEY extractor. See "EXTRACTOR ARGUMENTS" for details. You can use this option multiple times to give arguments for different extractors

batch_file.title: BatchFile
batch_file.description: File containing URLs to download ("-" for stdin), one URL per line. Lines starting with "#", ";" or "]" are considered as comments and ignored

no_batch_file.title: NoBatchFile
no_batch_file.description: Do not read URLs from batch file (default)

paths.title: Paths
paths.description: The paths where the files should be downloaded. Specify the type of file and the path separated by a colon ":". All the same TYPES as --output are supported. Additionally, you can also provide "home" (default) and "temp" paths. All intermediary files are first downloaded to the temp path and then the final files are moved over to the home path after download is finished. This option is ignored if --output is an absolute path

output.title: Output
output.description: Output filename template; see "OUTPUT TEMPLATE" for details

restrict_filenames.title: RestrictFilenames
restrict_filenames.description: Restrict filenames to only ASCII characters, and avoid "&" and spaces in filenames

no_restrict_filenames.title: NoRestrictFilenames
no_restrict_filenames.description: Allow Unicode characters, "&" and spaces in filenames (default)

trim_filenames.title: TrimFilenames
trim_filenames.description: Limit the filename length (excluding extension) to the specified number of characters

force_overwrites.title: ForceOverwrites
force_overwrites.description: Overwrite all video and metadata files. This option includes --no-continue

no_force_overwrites.title: NoForceOverwrites
no_force_overwrites.description: Do not overwrite the video, but overwrite related files (default)

no_continue.title: NoContinue
no_continue.description: Do not resume partially downloaded fragments. If the file is not fragmented, restart download of the entire file

part.title: Part
part.description: Use .part files instead of writing directly into output file (default)

no_part.title: NoPart
no_part.description: Do not use .part files - write directly into output file

mtime.title: Mtime
mtime.description: Use the Last-modified header to set the file modification time (default)

no_mtime.title: NoMtime
no_mtime.description: Do not use the Last-modified header to set the file modification time

write_description.title: WriteDescription
write_description.description: Write video description to a .description file

write_info_json.title: WriteInfoJSON
write_info_json.description: Write video metadata to a .info.json file (this may contain personal information)

write_playlist_metafiles.title: WritePlaylistMetafiles
write_playlist_metafiles.description: Write playlist metadata in addition to the video metadata when using --write-info-json, --write-description etc. (default)

no_write_playlist_metafiles.title: NoWritePlaylistMetafiles
no_write_playlist_metafiles.description: Do not write playlist metadata when using --write-info-json, --write-description etc.

clean_info_json.title: CleanInfoJSON
clean_info_json.description: Remove some internal metadata such as filenames from the infojson (default)

no_clean_info_json.title: NoCleanInfoJSON
no_clean_info_json.description: Write all fields to the infojson

write_comments.title: WriteComments
write_comments.description: Retrieve video comments to be placed in the infojson. The comments are fetched even without this option if the extraction is known to be quick

no_write_comments.title: NoWriteComments
no_write_comments.description: Do not retrieve video comments unless the extraction is known to be quick

load_info_json.title: LoadInfoJSON
load_info_json.description: JSON file containing the video information (created with the "--write-info-json" option)

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.description: Netscape formatted file to read cookies from and dump cookie jar in

no_cookies.title: NoCookies
no_cookies.description: Do not read/dump cookies from/to file (default)

cookies_from_browser.title: CookiesFromBrowser
cookies_from_browser.description: The name of the browser to load cookies from. Currently supported browsers are: brave, chrome, chromium, edge, firefox, opera, safari, vivaldi, whale. Optionally, the KEYRING used for decrypting Chromium cookies on Linux, the name/path of the PROFILE to load cookies from, and the CONTAINER name (if Firefox) ("none" for no container) can be given with their respective separators. By default, all containers of the most recently accessed profile are used. Currently supported keyrings are: basictext, gnomekeyring, kwallet, kwallet5, kwallet6

no_cookies_from_browser.title: NoCookiesFromBrowser
no_cookies_from_browser.description: Do not load cookies from browser (default)

cache_dir.title: CacheDir
cache_dir.description: Location in the filesystem where yt-dlp can store some downloaded information (such as client ids and signatures) permanently. By default ${XDG_CACHE_HOME}/yt-dlp

ignore_errors.title: IgnoreErrors
ignore_errors.description: Ignore download and postprocessing errors. The download will be considered successful even if the postprocessing fails

no_abort_on_error.title: NoAbortOnError
no_abort_on_error.description: Continue with next video on download errors; e.g. to skip unavailable videos in a playlist (default)

abort_on_error.title: AbortOnError
abort_on_error.description: Abort downloading of further videos if an error occurs

use_extractors.title: UseExtractors
use_extractors.description: Extractor names to use separated by commas. You can also use regexes, "all", "default" and "end" (end URL matching); e.g. --ies "holodex.*,end,youtube". Prefix the name with a "-" to exclude it, e.g. --ies default,-generic. Use --list-extractors for a list of extractor names.

default_search.title: DefaultSearch
default_search.description: Use this prefix for unqualified URLs. E.g. "gvsearch2:python" downloads two videos from google videos for the search term "python". Use the value "auto" to let yt-dlp guess ("auto_warning" to emit a warning when guessing). "error" just throws an error. The default value "fixup_error" repairs broken URLs, but emits an error if this is not possible instead of searching

ignore_config.title: IgnoreConfig
ignore_config.description: Don't load any more configuration files except those given to --config-locations. For backward compatibility, if this option is found inside the system configuration file, the user configuration is not loaded.

no_config_locations.title: NoConfigLocations
no_config_locations.description: Do not load any custom configuration files (default). When given inside a configuration file, ignore all previous --config-locations defined in the current file

config_locations.title: ConfigLocations
config_locations.description: Location of the main configuration file; either the path to the config or its containing directory ("-" for stdin). Can be used multiple times and inside other configuration files

plugin_dirs.title: PluginDirs
plugin_dirs.description: Path to an additional directory to search for plugins. This option can be used multiple times to add multiple directories. Use "default" to search the default plugin directories (default)

no_plugin_dirs.title: NoPluginDirs
no_plugin_dirs.description: Clear plugin directories to search, including defaults and those provided by previous --plugin-dirs

flat_playlist.title: FlatPlaylist
flat_playlist.description: Do not extract a playlist's URL result entries; some entry metadata may be missing and downloading may be bypassed

no_flat_playlist.title: NoFlatPlaylist
no_flat_playlist.description: Fully extract the videos of a playlist (default)

live_from_start.title: LiveFromStart
live_from_start.description: Download livestreams from the start. Currently experimental and only supported for YouTube and Twitch

no_live_from_start.title: NoLiveFromStart
no_live_from_start.description: Download livestreams from the current time (default)

wait_for_video.title: WaitForVideo
wait_for_video.description: Wait for scheduled streams to become available. Pass the minimum number of seconds (or range) to wait between retries

no_wait_for_video.title: NoWaitForVideo
no_wait_for_video.description: Do not wait for scheduled streams (default)

color.title: Color
color.description: Whether to emit color codes in output, optionally prefixed by the STREAM (stdout or stderr) to apply the setting to. Can be one of "always", "auto" (default), "never", or "no_color" (use non color terminal sequences). Use "auto-tty" or "no_color-tty" to decide based on terminal support only. Can be used multiple times

compat_options.title: CompatOptions
compat_options.description: Options that can help keep compatibility with youtube-dl or youtube-dlc configurations by reverting some of the changes made in yt-dlp. See "Differences in default behavior" for details

preset_alias.title: PresetAlias
preset_alias.description: Applies a predefined set of options. e.g. --preset-alias mp3. The following presets are available: mp3, aac, mp4, mkv, sleep. See the "Preset Aliases" section at the end for more info. This option can be used multiple times

geo_verification_proxy.title: GeoVerificationProxy
geo_verification_proxy.description: Use this proxy to verify the IP address for some geo-restricted sites. The default proxy specified by --proxy (or none, if the option is not present) is used for the actual downloading

xff.title: XFF
xff.description: How to fake X-Forwarded-For HTTP header to try bypassing geographic restriction. One of "default" (only when known to be useful), "never", an IP block in CIDR notation, or a two-letter ISO 3166-2 country code

write_link.title: WriteLink
write_link.description: Write an internet shortcut file, depending on the current platform (.url, .webloc or .desktop). The URL may be cached by the OS

write_url_link.title: WriteURLLink
write_url_link.description: Write a .url Windows internet shortcut. The OS caches the URL based on the file path

proxy.title: Proxy
proxy.description: Use the specified HTTP/HTTPS/SOCKS proxy. To enable SOCKS proxy, specify a proper scheme, e.g. socks5://user:pass@127.0.0.1:1080/. Pass in an empty string (--proxy "") for direct connection

socket_timeout.title: SocketTimeout
socket_timeout.description: Time to wait before giving up, in seconds

source_address.title: SourceAddress
source_address.description: Client-side IP address to bind to

impersonate.title: Impersonate
impersonate.description: Client to impersonate for requests. E.g. chrome, chrome-110, chrome:windows-10. Pass --impersonate="" to impersonate any client. Note that forcing impersonation for all requests may have a detrimental impact on download speed and stability

enable_file_urls.title: EnableFileURLs
enable_file_urls.description: Enable file:// URLs. This is disabled by default for security reasons.

extract_audio.title: ExtractAudio
extract_audio.description: Convert video files to audio-only files (requires ffmpeg and ffprobe)

audio_format.title: AudioFormat
audio_format.description: Format to convert the audio to when -x is used. (currently supported: best (default), aac, alac, flac, m4a, mp3, opus, vorbis, wav). You can specify multiple rules using similar syntax as --remux-video

audio_quality.title: AudioQuality
audio_quality.description: Specify ffmpeg audio quality to use when converting the audio with -x. Insert a value between 0 (best) and 10 (worst) for VBR or a specific bitrate like 128K (default 5)

remux_video.title: RemuxVideo
remux_video.description: Remux the video into another container if necessary (currently supported: avi, flv, gif, mkv, mov, mp4, webm, aac, aiff, alac, flac, m4a, mka, mp3, ogg, opus, vorbis, wav). If the target container does not support the video/audio codec, remuxing will fail. You can specify multiple rules; e.g. "aac>m4a/mov>mp4/mkv" will remux aac to m4a, mov to mp4 and anything else to mkv

recode_video.title: RecodeVideo
recode_video.description: Re-encode the video into another format if necessary. The syntax and supported formats are the same as --remux-video

postprocessor_args.title: PostProcessorArgs
postprocessor_args.description: Give these arguments to the postprocessors. Specify the postprocessor/executable name and the arguments separated by a colon ":" to give the argument to the specified postprocessor/executable. Supported PP are: Merger, ModifyChapters, SplitChapters, ExtractAudio, VideoRemuxer, VideoConvertor, Metadata, EmbedSubtitle, EmbedThumbnail, SubtitlesConvertor, ThumbnailsConvertor, FixupStretched, FixupM4a, FixupM3u8, FixupTimestamp and FixupDuration. The supported executables are: AtomicParsley, FFmpeg and FFprobe. You can also specify "PP+EXE:ARGS" to give the arguments to the specified executable only when being used by the specified postprocessor. Additionally, for ffmpeg/ffprobe, "_i"/"_o" can be appended to the prefix optionally followed by a number to pass the argument before the specified input/output file, e.g. --ppa "Merger+ffmpeg_i1:-v quiet". You can use this option multiple times to give different arguments to different postprocessors.

keep_video.title: KeepVideo
keep_video.description: Keep the intermediate video file on disk after post-processing

no_keep_video.title: NoKeepVideo
no_keep_video.description: Delete the intermediate video file after post-processing (default)

embed_subs.title: EmbedSubs
embed_subs.description: Embed subtitles in the video (only for mp4, webm and mkv videos)

embed_thumbnail.title: EmbedThumbnail
embed_thumbnail.description: Embed thumbnail in the video as cover art

embed_metadata.title: EmbedMetadata
embed_metadata.description: Embed metadata to the video file. Also embeds chapters/infojson if present unless --no-embed-chapters/--no-embed-info-json are used

no_embed_metadata.title: NoEmbedMetadata
no_embed_metadata.description: Do not add metadata to file (default)

embed_chapters.title: EmbedChapters
embed_chapters.description: Add chapter markers to the video file

embed_info_json.title: EmbedInfoJSON
embed_info_json.description: Embed the infojson as an attachment to mkv/mka video files

no_embed_info_json.title: NoEmbedInfoJSON
no_embed_info_json.description: Do not embed the infojson as an attachment to the video file

parse_metadata.title: ParseMetadata
parse_metadata.description: Parse additional metadata like title/artist from other fields; see "MODIFYING METADATA" for details. Supported values of "WHEN" are the same as that of --use-postprocessor (default: pre_process)

replace_in_metadata.title: ReplaceInMetadata
replace_in_metadata.description: Replace text in a metadata field using the given regex. This option can be used multiple times. Supported values of "WHEN" are the same as that of --use-postprocessor (default: pre_process)

xattrs.title: Xattrs
xattrs.description: Write metadata to the video file's xattrs (using Dublin Core and XDG standards)

concat_playlist.title: ConcatPlaylist
concat_playlist.description: Concatenate videos in a playlist. One of "never", "always", or "multi_video" (default; only when the videos form a single show). All the video files must have the same codecs and number of streams to be concatenable. The "pl_video:" prefix can be used with "--paths" and "--output" to set the output filename for the concatenated files. See "OUTPUT TEMPLATE" for details

fixup.title: Fixup
fixup.description: Automatically correct known faults of the file. One of never (do nothing), warn (only emit a warning), detect_or_warn (the default; fix the file if we can, warn otherwise), force (try fixing even if the file already exists)

ffmpeg_location.title: FFmpegLocation
ffmpeg_location.description: Location of the ffmpeg binary; either the path to the binary or its containing directory

exec.title: Exec
exec.description: Execute a command, optionally prefixed with when to execute it, separated by a ":". Supported values of "WHEN" are the same as that of --use-postprocessor (default: after_move). The same syntax as the output template can be used to pass any field as arguments to the command. If no fields are passed, %(filepath,_filename|)q is appended to the end of the command. This option can be used multiple times

convert_subs.title: ConvertSubs
convert_subs.description: Convert the subtitles to another format (currently supported: ass, lrc, srt, vtt). Use "--convert-subs none" to disable conversion (default)

convert_thumbnails.title: ConvertThumbnails
convert_thumbnails.description: Convert the thumbnails to another format (currently supported: jpg, png, webp). You can specify multiple rules using similar syntax as "--remux-video". Use "--convert-thumbnails none" to disable conversion (default)

split_chapters.title: SplitChapters
split_chapters.description: Split video into multiple files based on internal chapters. The "chapter:" prefix can be used with "--paths" and "--output" to set the output filename for the split files. See "OUTPUT TEMPLATE" for details

no_split_chapters.title: NoSplitChapters
no_split_chapters.description: Do not split video based on chapters (default)

remove_chapters.title: RemoveChapters
remove_chapters.description: Remove chapters whose title matches the given regular expression. The syntax is the same as --download-sections. This option can be used multiple times

no_remove_chapters.title: NoRemoveChapters
no_remove_chapters.description: Do not remove any chapters from the file (default)

force_keyframes_at_cuts.title: ForceKeyframesAtCuts
force_keyframes_at_cuts.description: Force keyframes at cuts when downloading/splitting/removing sections. This is slow due to needing a re-encode, but the resulting video may have fewer artifacts around the cuts

no_force_keyframes_at_cuts.title: NoForceKeyframesAtCuts
no_force_keyframes_at_cuts.description: Do not force keyframes around the chapters when cutting/splitting (default)

use_postprocessor.title: UsePostProcessor
use_postprocessor.description: The (case-sensitive) name of plugin postprocessors to be enabled, and (optionally) arguments to be passed to it, separated by a colon ":". ARGS are a semicolon ";" delimited list of NAME=VALUE. The "when" argument determines when the postprocessor is invoked. It can be one of "pre_process" (after video extraction), "after_filter" (after video passes filter), "video" (after --format; before --print/--output), "before_dl" (before each video download), "post_process" (after each video download; default), "after_move" (after moving the video file to its final location), "after_video" (after downloading and processing all formats of a video), or "playlist" (at end of playlist). This option can be used multiple times to add different postprocessors

sponsorblock_mark.title: SponsorblockMark
sponsorblock_mark.description: SponsorBlock categories to create chapters for, separated by commas. Available categories are sponsor, intro, outro, selfpromo, preview, filler, interaction, music_offtopic, poi_highlight, chapter, all and default (=all). You can prefix the category with a "-" to exclude it. See [1] for descriptions of the categories. E.g. --sponsorblock-mark all,-preview [1] https://wiki.sponsor.ajay.app/w/Segment_Categories

sponsorblock_remove.title: SponsorblockRemove
sponsorblock_remove.description: SponsorBlock categories to be removed from the video file, separated by commas. If a category is present in both mark and remove, remove takes precedence. The syntax and available categories are the same as for --sponsorblock-mark except that "default" refers to "all,-filler" and poi_highlight, chapter are not available

sponsorblock_chapter_title.title: SponsorblockChapterTitle
sponsorblock_chapter_title.description: An output template for the title of the SponsorBlock chapters created by --sponsorblock-mark. The only available fields are start_time, end_time, category, categories, name, category_names. Defaults to "[SponsorBlock]: %(category_names)l"

sponsorblock_api.title: SponsorblockAPI
sponsorblock_api.description: SponsorBlock API location, defaults to https://sponsor.ajay.app

list_subs.title: ListSubs
list_subs.description: List available subtitles of each video. Simulate unless --no-simulate is used

sub_format.title: SubFormat
sub_format.description: Subtitle format; accepts formats preference separated by "/", e.g. "srt" or "ass/srt/best"

sub_langs.title: SubLangs
sub_langs.description: Languages of the subtitles to download (can be regex) or "all" separated by commas, e.g. --sub-langs "en.*,ja" (where "en.*" is a regex pattern that matches "en" followed by 0 or more of any character). You can prefix the language code with a "-" to exclude it from the requested languages, e.g. --sub-langs all,-live_chat. Use --list-subs for a list of available language tags

no_write_thumbnail.title: NoWriteThumbnail
no_write_thumbnail.description: Do not write thumbnail image to disk (default)

write_all_thumbnails.title: WriteAllThumbnails
write_all_thumbnails.description: Write all thumbnail image formats to disk

list_thumbnails.title: ListThumbnails
list_thumbnails.description: List available thumbnails of each video. Simulate unless --no-simulate is used

quiet.title: Quiet
quiet.description: Activate quiet mode. If used with --verbose, print the log to stderr

simulate.title: Simulate
simulate.description: Do not download the video and do not write anything to disk

no_simulate.title: NoSimulate
no_simulate.description: Download the video even if printing/listing options are used

ignore_no_formats_error.title: IgnoreNoFormatsError
ignore_no_formats_error.description: Ignore "No video formats" error. Useful for extracting metadata even if the videos are not actually available for download (experimental)

no_ignore_no_formats_error.title: NoIgnoreNoFormatsError
no_ignore_no_formats_error.description: Throw error when no downloadable video formats are found (default)

skip_download.title: SkipDownload
skip_download.description: Do not download the video but write all related files

print.title: Print
print.description: Field name or output template to print to screen, optionally prefixed with when to print it, separated by a ":". Supported values of "WHEN" are the same as that of --use-postprocessor (default: video). Implies --quiet. Implies --simulate unless --no-simulate or later stages of WHEN are used. This option can be used multiple times

print_to_file.title: PrintToFile
print_to_file.description: Append given template to the file. The values of WHEN and TEMPLATE are the same as that of --print. FILE uses the same syntax as the output template. This option can be used multiple times

dump_json.title: DumpJSON
dump_json.description: Quiet, but print JSON information for each video. Simulate unless --no-simulate is used. See "OUTPUT TEMPLATE" for a description of available keys

dump_single_json.title: DumpSingleJSON
dump_single_json.description: Quiet, but print JSON information for each URL or infojson passed. Simulate unless --no-simulate is used. If the URL refers to a playlist, the whole playlist information is dumped in a single line

force_write_archive.title: ForceWriteArchive
force_write_archive.description: Force download archive entries to be written as far as no errors occur, even if -s or another simulation option is used

newline.title: Newline
newline.description: Output progress bar as new lines

progress.title: Progress
progress.description: Show progress bar, even if in quiet mode

progress_template.title: ProgressTemplate
progress_template.description: Template for progress outputs, optionally prefixed with one of "download:" (default), "download-title:" (the console title), "postprocess:",  or "postprocess-title:". The video's fields are accessible under the "info" key and the progress attributes are accessible under "progress" key. E.g. --console-title --progress-template "download-title:%(info.id)s-%(progress.eta)s"

dump_pages.title: DumpPages
dump_pages.description: Print downloaded pages encoded using base64 to debug problems (very verbose)

write_pages.title: WritePages
write_pages.description: Write downloaded intermediary pages to files in the current directory to debug problems

print_traffic.title: PrintTraffic
print_traffic.description: Display sent and read HTTP traffic

format.title: Format
format.description: Video format code, see "FORMAT SELECTION" for more details

format_sort.title: FormatSort
format_sort.description: Sort the formats by the fields given, see "Sorting Formats" for more details

format_sort_force.title: FormatSortForce
format_sort_force.description: Force user specified sort order to have precedence over all fields, see "Sorting Formats" for more details

no_format_sort_force.title: NoFormatSortForce
no_format_sort_force.description: Some fields have precedence over the user specified sort order (default)

video_multistreams.title: VideoMultistreams
video_multistreams.description: Allow multiple video streams to be merged into a single file

no_video_multistreams.title: NoVideoMultistreams
no_video_multistreams.description: Only one video stream is downloaded for each output file (default)

audio_multistreams.title: AudioMultistreams
audio_multistreams.description: Allow multiple audio streams to be merged into a single file

no_audio_multistreams.title: NoAudioMultistreams
no_audio_multistreams.description: Only one audio stream is downloaded for each output file (default)

prefer_free_formats.title: PreferFreeFormats
prefer_free_formats.description: Prefer video formats with free containers over non-free ones of the same quality. Use with "-S ext" to strictly prefer free containers irrespective of quality

no_prefer_free_formats.title: NoPreferFreeFormats
no_prefer_free_formats.description: Don't give any special preference to free containers (default)

check_formats.title: CheckFormats
check_formats.description: Make sure formats are selected only from those that are actually downloadable

check_all_formats.title: CheckAllFormats
check_all_formats.description: Check all formats for whether they are actually downloadable

no_check_formats.title: NoCheckFormats
no_check_formats.description: Do not check that the formats are actually downloadable

list_formats.title: ListFormats
list_formats.description: List available formats of each video. Simulate unless --no-simulate is used

merge_output_format.title: MergeOutputFormat
merge_output_format.description: Containers that may be used when merging formats, separated by "/", e.g. "mp4/mkv". Ignored if no merge is required. (currently supported: avi, flv, mkv, mov, mp4, webm)

playlist_items.title: PlaylistItems
playlist_items.description: Comma separated playlist_index of the items to download. You can specify a range using "[START]:[STOP][:STEP]". For backward compatibility, START-STOP is also supported. Use negative indices to count from the right and negative STEP to download in reverse order. E.g. "-I 1:3,7,-5::2" used on a playlist of size 15 will download the items at index 1,2,3,7,11,13,15

min_filesize.title: MinFileSize
min_filesize.description: Abort download if filesize is smaller than SIZE, e.g. 50k or 44.6M

max_filesize.title: MaxFileSize
max_filesize.description: Abort download if filesize is larger than SIZE, e.g. 50k or 44.6M

date.title: Date
date.description: Download only videos uploaded on this date. The date can be "YYYYMMDD" or in the format [now|today|yesterday][-N[day|week|month|year]]. E.g. "--date today-2weeks" downloads only videos uploaded on the same day two weeks ago

datebefore.title: DateBefore
datebefore.description: Download only videos uploaded on or before this date. The date formats accepted are the same as --date

dateafter.title: DateAfter
dateafter.description: Download only videos uploaded on or after this date. The date formats accepted are the same as --date

match_filters.title: MatchFilters
match_filters.description: Generic video filter. Any "OUTPUT TEMPLATE" field can be compared with a number or a string using the operators defined in "Filtering Formats". You can also simply specify a field to match if the field is present, use "!field" to check if the field is not present, and "&" to check multiple conditions. Use a "\" to escape "&" or quotes if needed. If used multiple times, the filter matches if at least one of the conditions is met. E.g. --match-filters !is_live --match-filters "like_count>?100 & description~='(?i)\bcats \& dogs\b'" matches only videos that are not live OR those that have a like count more than 100 (or the like field is not available) and also has a description that contains the phrase "cats & dogs" (caseless). Use "--match-filters -" to interactively ask whether to download each video

break_match_filters.title: BreakMatchFilters
break_match_filters.description: Same as "--match-filters" but stops the download process when a video is rejected

no_playlist.title: NoPlaylist
no_playlist.description: Download only the video, if the URL refers to a video and a playlist

yes_playlist.title: YesPlaylist
yes_playlist.description: Download the playlist, if the URL refers to a video and a playlist

age_limit.title: AgeLimit
age_limit.description: Download only videos suitable for the given age

download_archive.title: DownloadArchive
download_archive.description: Download only videos not listed in the archive file. Record the IDs of all downloaded videos in it

break_on_existing.title: BreakOnExisting
break_on_existing.description: Stop the download process when encountering a file that is in the archive supplied with the --download-archive option

no_break_on_existing.title: NoBreakOnExisting
no_break_on_existing.description: Do not stop the download process when encountering a file that is in the archive (default)

break_per_input.title: BreakPerInput
break_per_input.description: Alters --max-downloads, --break-on-existing, --break-match-filters, and autonumber to reset per input URL

no_break_per_input.title: NoBreakPerInput
no_break_per_input.description: --break-on-existing and similar options terminates the entire download queue

skip_playlist_after_errors.title: SkipPlaylistAfterErrors
skip_playlist_after_errors.description: Number of allowed failures until the rest of the playlist is skipped

legacy_server_connect.title: LegacyServerConnect
legacy_server_connect.description: Explicitly allow HTTPS connection to servers that do not support RFC 5746 secure renegotiation

prefer_insecure.title: PreferInsecure
prefer_insecure.description: Use an unencrypted connection to retrieve information about the video (Currently supported only for YouTube)

add_headers.title: AddHeaders
add_headers.description: Specify a custom HTTP header and its value, separated by a colon ":". You can use this option multiple times

bidi_workaround.title: BidiWorkaround
bidi_workaround.description: Work around terminals that lack bidirectional text support. Requires bidiv or fribidi executable in PATH

sleep_requests.title: SleepRequests
sleep_requests.description: Number of seconds to sleep between requests during data extraction

sleep_interval.title: SleepInterval
sleep_interval.description: Number of seconds to sleep before each download. This is the minimum time to sleep when used along with --max-sleep-interval

max_sleep_interval.title: MaxSleepInterval
max_sleep_interval.description: Maximum number of seconds to sleep. Can only be used along with --min-sleep-interval

sleep_subtitles.title: SleepSubtitles
sleep_subtitles.description: Number of seconds to sleep before each subtitle download
